Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2014 08:51PM Funclassygal wrote: For sure Monis - that picture said it all!  Today was an M.R.I. - of course they never told me with contrast.  So I get there and they sit me down and take an I.V. out - I was like "what is that?"  Then I was petrified that I may be allergic to whatever it was so I ask the girl if she has seen people get a reaction.  She says "Yes"  I say "what kind?"  She says "they can't breathe and vomit!"  I had one foot out the door but then thought how I better get used to this - stop being a big baby and just do it.  So I did and I was fine.  Wow, panic can really take over and I am good at it.  All of this is so new to me so it's really hard!

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2014 04:29PM Funclassygal wrote: PerAngusta, gave me such chills when I just read this. I also had hair - one length down my back - constant compliments on it. The hardest part of all of this so far was the day I sat in that chair and they took my hair. But, we do what we have to do when we have no choice. Yes, like they all tell us, it will grow back - and it will - it's hard to deal with. As far as the chemo - I sailed right through it and I hope you do also. It is very different today and trust me I was petrified - 100% a baby - but it was ok. I am scheduled for surgery on January 13th and I am not so scared of this. Never been in a hospital - never nothing! They want to do direct implants as I am not a candidate for the expanders. Wonder why you vomited so much - were you just allergic to the anesthesia?

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2014 08:35PM Funclassygal wrote: Hi mmtagirl, I am going on my 5th out of 12 weekly taxol - already did the 4 A/C. They are telling me that I don't have to do the right and if I do there is not much difference as far as survival.  I have a 6cm in the left breast (shrunk by now of course), ILC - the sneaky one is who got me.  After the surgery, they highly recommend radiation which I am not happy with.  I was not happy with chemo either but I thank God every day that I have done really well with it.  Are you happy with all of your decisions?  It's so hard to really know if you are doing the right thing.  Oh and that pill that I have to take for 10 years also makes me uneasy.  My ONC said only 1% chance of causing something in the uterus.  Just don't know.  Thanks for your help, VeraAnn
